qpe_definition.special_rules: Qualified expenditure includes costs incurred in South Korea for production. Must have at least 80% foreign financing to qualify as international production. Two tiers: 20% for minimum 5-day shoot with KRW 100M spend; 25% for minimum 10-day shoot with KRW 800M spend. Animation productions can qualify if significant work performed in Korea.

spv_requirements: Must work with Korean production service company. Foreign producer applies through Korean partner.
notes: KOFIC (Korean Film Council) administers the location incentive for foreign productions. Two rate tiers: 20% rebate for 5+ day shoot with minimum KRW 100 million (approx USD $75k) qualified spend, OR 25% rebate for 10+ day shoot with minimum KRW 800 million (approx USD $600k) qualified spend. Cap of KRW 200 million (approx USD $150k) per project on the rebate amount. Must be at least 80% foreign-financed. Eligible for feature films, TV series, documentaries, and animation. South Korea has a growing animation industry with strong technical capabilities and cost-competitive labor. The per-project cap limits the incentive's value for very large productions, making it most attractive for mid-budget projects. Cash rebate paid after completion. Seoul Film Commission and regional film commissions also offer additional location support and services. Note: This is separate from domestic Korean production tax credits (5-15% for Korean companies producing content).
